references: M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards Applied Math. Series 55, 1964 (and various reprintings), p. 811.
links: M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards, Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972 [alternative scanned copy].
Simon Plouffe, Plouffe's Inverter, Zeta(9)=sum(1/n^9, n=1..infinity); to 20000 digits
formula: From _Peter Bala_, Dec 04 2013: (Start)Definition: zeta(9) = sum {n >= 1} 1/n^9.zeta(9) = 2^9/(2^9 - 1)*( sum {n even} n^7*p(n)*p(1/n)/(n^2 - 1)^10 ), where p(n) = n^4 + 10*n^2 + 5. See A013663, A013671 and A013675. (End)zeta(9) = Sum_{n >= 1} (A010052(n)/n^(9/2)) = Sum_{n >= 1} ( (floor(sqrt(n))-floor(sqrt(n-1)))/n^(9/2) ). - _Mikael Aaltonen_, Feb 22 2015
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
